an3.113:1.1: “Mendicants, three kinds of people are bound for a place of loss, bound for hell, if they don’t give up this fault.
an3.113:1.3: Someone who is unchaste, but claims to be celibate;
an3.113:1.4: someone who makes a groundless accusation of unchastity against a person whose celibacy is pure;
an3.113:1.5: and someone who has the view, ‘There is nothing wrong with sensual pleasures,’ so they throw themselves into sensual pleasures.
an3.113:1.6: These are the three kinds of people bound for a place of loss, bound for hell, if they don’t give up this fault.”
